newsitem.title: LATVIA: RTF SAYS SEES CLOSE TO PLAN ON Q1 RESULTS.
newsitem.headline: RTF SAYS SEES CLOSE TO PLAN ON Q1 RESULTS.

text.p: Riga Transport Fleet (RTF) said on Wednesday that its first quarter results were close to target although it would not reveal any figures.
"We do not have the results yet but I believe that there will be no large deviations from plan," Oleg Kolosov, RTF's general manager, told Reuters.
The company said that the first quarter results will be made available on April 24.
RTF refused to name the target figures for 1997 as they were currently undergoing a review.
Its profit for distribution was 1.23 million lats in the first quarter of 1996 on turnover of 3.88 million lats and expenses of 2.64 million lats.
The company has already said it plans to pay one dividend per share out of its 1996 profits, which will be voted on at the shareholder meeting.
It said it has 17 refrigerator ships, operating throughout the world.
RTF is 55.5 percent by Greek Lavinia Corp, the fourth largest reefer company in the world. New Century Holdings have 22.3 percent and employees 12.6 percent.
Four of its vessels were bought in the summer of 1996 while the rest are from Soviet times.
